Integrating Microsoft Dynamics 365 CRM and ServiceNow: A Complete Guide

Microsoft Dynamics 365 CRM and ServiceNow are two of the most popular software solutions that organizations use to streamline their operations and deliver an excellent customer experience. Both platforms are packed with features and functionalities that allow businesses to manage their customer data, automate processes, and provide faster resolution to customer issues. However, in most cases, businesses use both platforms to serve different purposes, which means they have to switch between them to access the data they need. This can lead to inefficiencies and confusion, especially when working with customer data.

Integrating Microsoft Dynamics 365 CRM and ServiceNow through API or SDK

Thankfully, it is possible to integrate Microsoft Dynamics 365 CRM and ServiceNow so that they work together seamlessly. The integration can be achieved through APIs or SDKs, which allow the two platforms to communicate and share data in real-time. The API-based integration allows the two platforms to establish a connection, which enables data to flow between them automatically. SDK integration, on the other hand, is a more advanced integration solution that requires developers to write custom code to connect the two platforms.

Problems the integration solves

Integrating Microsoft Dynamics 365 CRM and ServiceNow solves several problems that organizations face when using the two platforms separately. Here are some of the problems that the integration solves:

1. Data duplication

Without integration, data duplication is likely to occur since your team has to update both platforms separately. Integration eliminates data duplication since data is updated automatically in both platforms, once it is updated in either of the two platforms. This means your team can focus on providing better services to customers, rather than spending time manually updating data across multiple platforms.

2. Manual processes

The integration removes the need for manual processes since teams can complete tasks in one platform, and the data is automatically synchronized across both platforms. This means your team can close tickets, update contact information, and view customer data from a single platform, rather than switching between two platforms.

3. Streamlined workflows and improved productivity

The integration between the two platforms creates streamlined workflows, which leads to improved productivity. Teams can complete tasks faster, which means that customer requests are processed more efficiently. This leads to happier customers, as they receive faster resolution to their issues.

Conclusion

If your organization uses Microsoft Dynamics 365 CRM and ServiceNow, it is recommended that you integrate the two platforms. The integration will reduce manual processes, eliminate data duplication, and improve productivity. By using APIs or SDKs, developers can create a robust integration that ensures that data is automatically updated across both platforms. This will allow your team to focus on delivering exceptional customer service, without worrying about switching between two platforms or updating data manually.
